messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I feel like a failure
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: moonwindstarsky [mailto:moonwindstarsky@yahoo.com] Sent: Monday, April 19, 2004 11:46 PM To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com Subject:
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: moonwindstarsky [mailto:moonwindstarsky@...]
Sent: Monday, April 19, 2004 11:46 PM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I feel like a failure

I want to quit, but am too scared to, is this common?




I'm guessing you mean quit unschooling? I think it's not uncommon to feel
anxious, or sometimes question if what you're doing is best for your kids,
or yourself. How long have you been unschooling? How old are your kids?
Do you have support or opposition? Are you going through a particular
struggle, or just feeling exhausted? More information would help a lot in
knowing how to respond best to the question. :-)

Hang in there.
Marjorie, who just helped organize a by-monthly unschoolers discussion group
to give me that boost when needed!

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I feel like a failure
messages.msgSnippet: I believe from your previous posts that you are a high school age  girl who has been with us on the list for a short while and have also posted on the message
messages.messageBody:
I believe from your previous posts that you are a high school age girl who has been with us on the list for a short while and have also posted on the message board...Is this correct?
If so Hi-and yes a lot of us have concerns before we "make the move".
Well I guess if I was sitting having a coffee with you in person I might ask what your real joys and interests are. Are they such that you can get just so involved in following your interests that one day soon you just don't have time to bother going to public school? LOL
Actually if we knew more about your situation , plans, interests, reasons, parents viewpoint many of us would be more than happy to make more useful comments or offer some ideas.
But yes, thinking of leaving public school could be too scary if you are thinking of it as quitting. If you are looking ahead to having more time and energy and enthusiasm to follow some dreams its more like coming in from the cold to a warm and exciting place.
Take care now...
grace
in the Beautiful BC Rockies
where some coyotes howling are driving Xena; my Doberman "nuts" so better bring her back in before she wakes everyone.

----- Original Message -----
From: moonwindstarsky

I want to quit, but am too scared to, is this common?




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I feel like a failure
messages.msgSnippet: Scared to quit school? Using a curriculum? You want to quit unschooling? Sometimes I ve wanted to
messages.messageBody:
<< I want to quit, but am too scared to, is this common? >>

Scared to quit school?
Using a curriculum?

You want to quit unschooling?

Sometimes I've wanted to just quit life. That's a dangerous place for
mothers of children to be. So if you're talking depression, that's big and you
should get help to breathe and think better.

If you're talking fear of unschooling, we can help you lots and easily, I
think.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I feel like a failure
messages.msgSnippet: quit what? We all want to quit occassionally.  I want to run away and live a life of clean houses, no children, few bills, and then I realize what I d miss.
messages.messageBody:
quit what?

We all want to quit occassionally. I want to run away and live a life
of clean houses, no children, few bills, and then I realize what I'd miss.

Joylyn
